reasoning: SIRS incidence estimated from sepsis epidemiology and critical care cohorts. Global sepsis incidence ~100-300 per 100k person-years; using conservative middle estimate of ~85 per 100k for clinically significant SIRS presentations. Confidence limited by lack of standardized population-based surveillance.
source: Dellinger RP et al. (2008). Surviving Sepsis Campaign: International guidelines for management of severe sepsis and septic shock. Crit Care Med. 36(1):296-327. Combined with sepsis epidemiology literature.
